intro: Stobaea acarnoides, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Stobaea acarnoides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
